original_claim: Nigel Farage has stood for a re-election in the UK Parliament three times.
perplexity_response: The claim that Nigel Farage has stood for re-election in the UK Parliament three times is not supported. Nigel Farage has stood for election to the UK Parliament eight times, including his successful bid in 2024, but there is no specific mention of him standing for re-election three times[1][3]. Re-election implies that he was already a sitting MP, which was not the case until his 2024 victory.

citations.evidence: "Nigel Farage has become an MP and will bring his upstart Reform Party to the U.K. parliament. On his eighth attempt at entering the House of Commons..."
"Farage has stood for election to the House of Commons eight times, in six general elections and two by-elections, losing in every attempt until 2024 in Clacton."

original_claim: The top three selling UK artists are Cliff Richard, The Beatles and David Bowie.
perplexity_response: The claim is not supported. The top-selling UK artists in terms of albums and singles do not align with the claim. For instance, The Beatles are consistently ranked as the top-selling UK artists in both albums and singles, but there is no evidence placing Cliff Richard and David Bowie in the top three together in album sales. In singles sales, Cliff Richard is among the top sellers, but David Bowie is not listed as high as Cliff Richard or The Beatles[2][3][4]. In album sales, Queen and other artists like Madonna and Michael Jackson are often listed ahead of David Bowie[5].

citations.evidence: "The list reveals The Beatles at the top, having sold the most chart singles over the past 60 years in the UK, followed by Elvis Presley and Sir Cliff Richard – all three have sold more than 20m singles in the UK."
"The Beatles top the chart with a combined singles sales total of 22.1 million singles."

"The list reveals The Beatles at the top, having sold the most chart singles over the past 60 years in the UK, followed by Elvis Presley and Sir Cliff Richard – all three have sold more than 20m singles in the UK."

original_claim: In the current UK Parliament there are 400 Labour MPs and 121 Conservative MPs.
perplexity_response: The claim is not supported. According to the current composition of the UK Parliament, there are 406 Labour MPs (not 400) and 121 Conservative MPs[1][5]. This discrepancy in the number of Labour MPs makes the claim inaccurate.

citations.evidence: "The Labour Party formed a majority government under the leadership of Keir Starmer, winning over 400 seats. ... | Labour|411|406|5|"

original_claim: More than half of UK undergraduates say they use AI to help with essays.
perplexity_response: The claim that more than half of UK undergraduates use AI to help with essays is **supported**. Multiple studies and surveys indicate that a significant majority of UK students utilize AI for academic purposes, including essay writing. For instance, a study by the Higher Education Policy Institute (HEPI) found that 53% of students report using generative AI to assist with test preparation, which includes generating material for work they would be marked on[1][2][4]. Additionally, while not all students use AI specifically for writing essays, the prevalence of AI use in academic settings is widespread[1][2].

citations.evidence: "53% of students report using generative AI to assist with test preparation. Specifically, when using generative AI to create text for examinations, more than one in eight students (13%) usually change the content before turning it in."
"More than half of UK university students have used generative artificial intelligence to help them with their studies, a survey suggests."
"A survey of more than 1,000 UK undergraduates, conducted by the Higher Education Policy Institute (Hepi), found 53 per cent were using AI to generate material for work they would be marked on."
